body:
Yes, please, can you hook me up?  Getting an AWS Windows instance to the
point where I can do work is really painful.


On Sun, Feb 8, 2015 at 7:36 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Assigned to Keith, then.
>
> Keith, you can now use gomote to have a remote ephemeral Windows instances
> available for interactive development. The gomote tool is still new and not
> fully polished, but it's getting there. Let me know if you'd like to use it
> to debug/test this, without having to use an actual Windows VM or machine.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/9804#issuecomment-73453146>.
>
